In a data sample of ≈ 1.8 fb⁻¹, recorded with the CDF II detector at the Fermilab Tevatron, they select events with W + 1 or 2 jets. They use the charge correlation between the W and the muon from the semileptonic decay of a charm hadron to extract the We signal. They measure σ{sub Wc} (p{sub Tc} > 20 GeV/c, </subfield><subfield code=" ">< 1.5) x BR(W → ℓν) = 9.8 ± 3.2 pb, in agreement with theoretical expectations.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="536" all_text_timv: First measurement of the production of a W boson in association with a single charm quark in p anti-p collisions at s**(1/2) = 1.96-TeV [electronic resource]. Washington, D.C. : United States. Dept. of Energy, 2007. Oak Ridge, Tenn. : Distributed by the Office of Scientific and Technical Information, U.S. Dept. of Energy. 7 pages : digital, PDF file. text txt rdacontent computer c rdamedia online resource cr rdacarrier Published through SciTech Connect. 11/01/2007. "fermilab-pub-07-616-e" "arXiv eprint number arXiv:0711.2901" FT Aaltonen, T.; Adelman, J.; Alvarez Gonzalez, B.; Amerio, S.; Amidei, D.; Anastassov, A.; Annovi, A.; Antos, J.; Akimoto, T.; Aoki, M.; Albrow, M.G. Free-to-read Unrestricted online access star The authors present the first measurement of the production cross section of a W boson with a single charm quark (c) in p{bar p} collisions at √s = 1.96 TeV, using soft muon tagging of c jets. In a data sample of ≈ 1.8 fb⁻¹, recorded with the CDF II detector at the Fermilab Tevatron, they select events with W + 1 or 2 jets. They use the charge correlation between the W and the muon from the semileptonic decay of a charm hadron to extract the We signal. They measure σ{sub Wc} (p{sub Tc} > 20 GeV/c,  < 1.5) x BR(W → ℓν) = 9.8 ± 3.2 pb, in agreement with theoretical expectations.
